question: The use of Social Media is replacing face-to-face contact with many people. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
text: As recently, huge technology advancements had occurred, many aspects of our lives have been affected by this phenomenon and one of which is our social interactions. Since social media apps had been developed, most of our face-to-face contacts have become obsolete. This change in our behaviour offers certain advantages like enabling accessibility while bringing disadvantages like providing an illusion of a utopian lifestyle.

To commence with, we discuss the benefits of social media. Firstly, in contrast with traditional face-to-face interactions, technology offers a method to make contact with whomever we want in a matter of seconds. For instance, if you want to talk to your friend from another country, you could do that by a simple video call while the other way would be to book for planes, travel for a day or two and then you could meet him in person. Secondly, since all the travelling costs have been cut, you can make contact many times cheaper.

On the other hand, social media has its own demerits. Although it has enabled us with easier social interactions, it also has provided a choice of selective projection of our lives. Since most people are not comfortable sharing their unpleasant moments and experiences, social media has transformed into a utopian community in where everyone is a contented individual with a successful career. As a result, most users tend to get more depressed by comparing their real-life to the illusion appeared by their friends. For example, as a 24-year-old student when I see celebrities and successful entrepreneurs, I can't help but  feel frustrated. Set this aside, another disadvantage of social media comes with the lack of body language observation. As an evolved species, this physical interaction plays a crucial role in our mutual understandings. Therefore by contacting in virtual environments, we are discarding this factor which would probably lead to miscommunication.

In conclusion, social media has provided many benefits like 24/7 contact availability, while bringing disadvantages like misunderstandings and depression. However, in my opinion, the merits far outweigh its demerits.
